headline: Mediterranean Chicken
description: This Mediterranean chicken recipe features plenty of olives, onion, tomatoes, and herbs for a deliciously light dinner that won't disappoint.
name: Mediterranean Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Heat white wine and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until golden, about 4 to 6 minutes on each side. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.

Add garlic to pan drippings; sauté for 30 seconds. Add onion; cook and stir until onions are tender, about 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and add 1/2 cup white wine; simmer for 10 minutes. Add thyme and basil and simmer for 5 more minutes.

Return chicken to skillet, cover, and cook over low heat until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink inside. Add olives and parsley; cook for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

review.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this recipe, simple and not too many ingredients but lots of flavour. Modifications: Ended up using “Aylmer Accents” diced tomatoes that had a bit more flavour to start with. Didn’t have fresh herbs so added dried herbs at the same time as the white wine.
Really good. I read comments and added artichoke hearts and feta. We like veggies so also added some zucchini. Used the canned diced tomatoes and Italian seasoning in place of fresh. Great flavor!
I added more tomatoes to have more sauce, i ate mine with barley, rice and quinoa. Everything turned out really good. Thank you for a great recipe.

This recipe is easy and delicious! I used dry sherry as the white wine. I also used dry seasoning instead of fresh, 1/2 teaspoon of basil, 1/2 teaspoon of parsley, and 1 teaspoon of thyme. I loved it!!!
Been making this for years, then had a genius idea to marinade the chicken overnight in olive juice and thyme. It came out amazing! My husband loves “olive chicken” as much as I do!
This was a very easy and very tasty. I did cut the chicken up into bite size pieces and added some red pepper flakes to give it some spice. Serviced over pasta, vey good. Bev
Served it with couscous

Loved this recipe! Since my chicken was cooked quite a bit before I added the tomatoes later in the recipe along with the olives so that they still had their shape. I also threw in some quartered artichoke hearts that were in the refrigerator next to the olives. I will definitely make this again!
simmer chicken for only 15-20 minutes next time
Bland

I made the recommended adjustments offered by other reviewers - double the sauce, use canned chopped tomatoes with the juice, added feta, and cut up the chicken. We had it over pasta and it was a hit! 
We will definitely make this again!
Used fire roasted canned tomatoes, added extra olives, a can of artichoke hearts, handful of spinach, and feta cheese.
I really like it the way it is, and will make again
Wonderful change of flavor for flounder. We really enjoyed this. I did substitute canned diced tomatoes for the Roma tomatoes since we didn’t have them. They worked well,
Easy to make; next time I would as a few more spices or more of the basil and thyme.
I added a extra white cooking wine and little chicken broth to the skillet when sautéing the vegetables - skillet got to hot and there was not much liquid left

Prep time is way off. After chopping vegetables, cook time is closer to 40 minutes (10 minutes step 1, 15 minutes step 2, 15 minutes step 3 for large breasts). Parsley is too strong, and not enough sauce.
Turned out delicious- after I added Romano cheese and extra pepper. It’s a great way to use all the tomatoes from my garden
Quick and easy! Had 1 oz of pasta for lunch. I'll add a side of veggies to it for dinner. It will be in my menu rotation for awhile. I cut the chicken into bite sized chunks.
Per recommendations in previous reviews I made a lot of extra sauce & added extra olives. My guests & I really enjoyed this very tender chicken.
Loved this recipe!!! So good!

Husband and I loved it! Used three boneless skinless chicken thighs since it’s just the two of us. Kept all other ingredients the same and served over risotto. Didn’t have white wine, so I used ¼ c cab sav + ¼ c red wine vinegar. Threw it all in the crockpot in the morning and let it ride on low until dinner time.
This is delicious! I didn't have fresh tomatoes or any fresh herbs so I used canned tomatoes and dried herbs. I did use fresh garlic. The flavor is so good!

This came out excellent tonight. Although the chicken in the pic did becomes a bit pale after covering and simmering for a while, it was definitely browned as the recipe dictates. I used Kim Crawford sav blanc, but I think a good chardonnay might be more appealing.

I cook for only myself, so I cut down on the chicken. I also used fresh diced tomatoes, because I prefer fresh to canned.

This is a definite keeper!
very good! adding artichoke and feta sounds even better. served with risotto, bc that's what I had available. worked pretty well together.
very good! adding artichoke and feta sounds even better. served with risotto, bc that's what I had available. worked pretty well together.
Great dish . I have remade it several times! My family loved it.
Loved this recipe. Added garlic salt and pepper to both sides of the chicken before sautée-ing it. Added 2 cups of spinach in the last 5 minutes. Delicious!

Everyone loved it. 
Didn't have mushrooms, used kalamata olives for black olives, added a little tomato paste to thicken the sauce. Very good.

This was very tasty! I didn’t have a couple things so I compromised. I did not have wine nor did I have any thyme so I added Italian seasoning. I used 1 can of stewed tomatoes and added about 10 or 12 cherry tomatoes halved and added half way through the last 15 minutes with the parsley and olives. Served with Couscous which complemented it nicely. Will make again.

First Mediterranean dish I’ve ever made. I added some other vegetables and artichoke hearts along with olives, to make it my own. Used chicken thighs, instead of breasts. I loved it and my Lebanese roommate said he really liked it. Dying to make it again.
Awesome recipe!
Made it per instructed. Very nice

I loved this, I subbed capers instead of the olives, and used dried seasonings for those of which I didn't have fresh. I just added more wine as I felt it was thinning too much and served over rice, with crusty bread. It was really really good. A sprinkle of feta was also yummy.

I did not have white wine but substituted chicken broth. I used a large can of diced tomatoes and doubled the garlic. I also added Mediterranean style feta bites and spinach. This was a home run for myself and my kids. Highly recommend!

I followed some other folks' modifications to double the sauce and add some other ingredients to make this snazzier. Wife and kid loved it. For me, I need to watch how long I cooked the chicken. Chicken scares me, so I waited too long to check it for doneness. It didn't take half as long as I thought it would just simmering. Other than that, awesome!
Wonderful recipe! followed suggestions and used canned tomatoes. Added mushrooms and a little hot pepper. Next time want to serve with pasta and bread.

I added one couple water, quarter cup of Wondra to thicken, 1 container of come party tomatoes from Kroger, 1 can original Rotel, 1- 14.5 oz can of Hunts tomato sauce, 1 avocado to thicken, , 1 cup of Crimini mushrooms, one green pepper, 1/2 a jar of Kalamati Olives.

Husband loved it! I did put in a cup of onion instead of 1/2 c., and also added a jar of marinated artichoke hearts along with the can of diced tomatoes (the kind in Italian seasonings). I also added 1 T. Italian seasoning with the other herbs. Also used closer to 1 c. of the wine. I had problems with the chicken (boneless, 
skinless thighs) getting browned, what with the wine being in the pan with the oil, so I heated up another fry pan with some olive oil and browned it up in that. While that was browning I worked on the sauce. When the chicken was done in that pan, I fried up some zucchini, onions and mushrooms with some more Italian seasoning in what was left from browning the chicken. It all came out great. I served the chicken over basmati rice, and sprinkled with feta. Awesome!

Used canned diced tomatoes, italian seasoning for herbs and black olives and artichokes as the kids don't like stronger olives. Also put in 9 oz. package of refrigerated cheese tortellini. Honestly, I think I'll keep the sauce, it's pretty foolproof, but the tortellini was way better in this than the chicken and easier. Thanks for a great base recipe!
Covered the chicken, added artichoke hearts and topped with feta. Yummy
It so good and yummy I have

I made this recipe for myself while my husband was out of town. I liked it so much I made it again when he got home. He loved it and gave it two thumbs up. I did not add the olives, since I don't care for them. I used frozen blanched tomatoes from my freezer as well as a cup of homemade tomato sauce. The extra sauce I spooned over the accompanying veggies. I gave this recipe to two friends without them asking for it, I liked it that much! Oh, I also added feta cheese just before serving.

My husband and I loved this! I added feta and red pepper flakes and used canned diced tomatoes with jalapeños but besides those alterations I followed the recipe exactly. We will definitely be making this again.
My daughter said it was the best Chicken dish! Very easy to make even on a work night.

After seeing other reviews, I doubled the amount of sauce, used chopped canned tomatoes with juice instead of fresh, and added one 14 oz can artichoke hearts. Served with brown rice/mushroom pilaf, then tried leftovers with plain white jasmine rice. Loved it with either! Sauce is great over the rice.
Beautiful dish tasted great
Made it! Used two cans diced tomatoes and it was amazing!
Came out great what awesome flavors

I lòved this recipe. So did my guests and family. I actually made a mistake and put all the wine in the pan at the beginning. The difference it made was that it was hard to brown the chicken. Added more wine later and the results were fabulous.

I have to agree with several other reviewers who said it was pretty boring. I ended up adding fresh chopped cilantro and creaole seasoning to the already cooked mixture. I also made it ahead, put it into a greased casserole dish and baked it in the oven (time saver), topping it with cheese about the last 15 minutes of heating. It's a pretty healthy dish....just a little boring without adding more to the recipe.
We liked this dish. I added mushrooms and used black olives in place of kalamta. It was good but not outstanding.
Yes I’d make it again
Great flavor and easy to make. We loved it! A keeper, for sure!
It was so easy as it all just comes together in one pan, perfect seasoning, will definitely make it again.
Delicious and easy to do. I will definitely make this again!
This recipe was so easy and delicious. We used the leftovers in a salad the next day and they were wonderful in that too.
Loved this reicep was moist and flavorful. My husband really enjoyed it. We will have this again.
I made no changes to the recipe but still I found it to be a bit dry! Otherwise the flavor was Wonderful!
I made no changes. It was good, but don't think my husband cared for it. He just said, it was all right. He's more of a meat and potatoes guy though. Healthy though.
Very delicious. Used canned diced tomatoes which provided extra sauce. Family enjoyed it, will definitely make again.
It was delicious and easy to make. Family enjoyed.

Couple of comments, 6 chicken breast halves, was it supposed to be half of a chickens breast or one half of a Chickens breast, because 6 Chicken breast halves are larger than my largest skillet, also 3 cups tomatoes chopped, was that fresh tomatoes, or canned tomatoes, because fresh tomatoes are not as juicy and they don't sell chopped canned tomatoes, even though I used fresh tomatoes, but had to cut each chicken breast in half, so only actually used 3 Chicken breasts.
Very good! Didn’t make any changes. Family enjoyed it.
Delicious!! I added Feta the last 5 minutes because it’s a Greek thing
I felt it needed a little more salt, but otherwise the flavor was really good.

I made this true to speed but used tilapia instead of chicken and two cans of organic diced tomatoes. It’s June, and tomatoes are still green!
Big hit. Also used and shaved home grown garlic and herbs.
Delish. This is a versatile sauce and cans can be made for various proteins!
Thanks
The fresh herbs make the dish. Don't skimp on the simmering time.
I made this as per the recipe and both my wife and I agree that it was delicious and worth doing again.
Definitely will be making again.
I followed the directions exactly as stated. the dish came out excellent and was liked by all. Very tasty with the fresh herbs.

I've made this many times, usually as noted in the recipe. The only changes I make that I think add more flavor are to season the chicken before cooking (I use Montreal Seasoning). It's a little bland if you season it at the end. I've also tried it with green olives and they are just as tasty. It tastes like a gourmet meal without the effort. Great recipe. Thank you!
Everyone loved it. Had great flavor, and was SO easy to prepare!
Easy to make. Chicken comes out juicy and tender. Not dry at all. I threw some leftovers into a salad and it was delicious.
this was just OK. Family was not crazy about this recipe. Will not make again. I like the ingredients but not the finished product.
I was a little unsure of the kalamata olives, but they actually make the dish!
Cut recipe in half and still came out great.
This was delicious. I did add artichokes and feta cheese. I also used canned diced tomatoes and regular black olives. But a definite do again
I didn't use olives and I put cilantro instead of parsley. came out really good; the wine adds a rich flavor. Will do again
I need to double the sauce, but the entire family absolutely loved this! Added bell pepper, mushrooms, zucchini, noodles, and topped with feta. Can't wait for tmrws leftovers. Yay.
Awesome recipe....

This was a really great low carb, healthy, easy meal. I made it just as is except I had to add a lot more liquid because it got dry in the pan. I used cherry tomatoes cut in half, which aren’t as juicy, could be why. Great flavor with the tomatoes and Kalamata olives. Even my meat-hating kids ate it. 2 thumbs up!

My husband and I both liked it. The next time I make it I will season the chicken so it’s more flavorful. I added more wine and ingredients to increase the amount of sauce based on the other reviews. I followed the recipe and used fresh tomatoes and it turned out great. Will definitely make this again.

I have made this numerous times and we love it. I do however bake mine in a 9x12" pan once I've assembled it..350 for 1 hour. We shred any leftover chicken and combine all remaining ingredients with brown rice for a delicious second meal.
I thought it was really good, but my husband wouldn’t give me a response, so I will try it on my daughters next.

We made this following the recipe. The only difference was we used two breasts instead of six. I would say that our two breasts would have been equivalent to 4-6 breasts. We were extremely pleased with the dish. The balance of flavors was excellent, no flavor overtook the dish and they all brought something to it. We did use the fresh tomatoes and herbs. When we make again we will precut the breasts into serving size (4oz each) and we will also salt and pepper the breasts and the tomatoes as we add them instead of at the end. Also, we will make sure to serve with a nice crusty bread!

This is one of the best chicken recipes I've ever tried! It was delicious, and smelled so good while cooking. It was simple yet so impressive. I plan to serve this to guests next week. I served mine over yellow rice.

Made the recipe as it was stated. Used 2 cans of diced tomatoes instead of chopping fresh ones to get 3 cups of tomatoes. Served over 2/3 cup of white rice that we mixed in before serving and it was delicious. Adding this to our nightly mix of recipes.
Loved this!! So tasty!! Definitely will make again!
I added cumin and a little lime juice. Served it with quinoa and brown rice. Was really good and will definitely make it again.
I made this chicken recipe since my family loves chicken. The basil and thyme gave it a great flavor with white wine.
Will totally make again. I am a super novice cook and this was really easy. The ratios don't really matter that much, so it's pretty hard to mess up

I loved the flavors--I used organic chicken breasts, so chicken was already juicy and flavorful. I would add more juices for more sauce next time. I like to add some kalamata olive juice as well to give a little more "pizzaz." My husband, who does not like chicken as a rule, liked it very much!
Split it down for two, excellent dinner
Chicken breast dry...good for a low calorie meal. I served it over rice.

On the up side, the chicken was juicy and there was quite a bit of sauce. On the down side, I found the thyme to be a bit strong and the basil taste non-existent. The next time, I will substitute oregano for the thyme and increase the basil. It's such an easy dish to prepare that I think it's just a matter of tweaking it a bit for my taste. It's well worth the effort for this good 1-pan chicken dish.
The only thing I did differently was brine the breast in sugar and salt! The chicken came out succulent and very moist! The flavors were really good together! I will make it again!
Good but lots of work!
It was very good indeed. I only made a minor change and added a tablespoon of paprika, personal choice. Be careful not to overcook the sauce.
